alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 6:27PM EDT until August 22 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including Franklin County. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding was reported near Rocky Mount and also west of Ferrum. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocky Mount, Boones Mill, Ferrum, Wirtz, Callaway, Burnt Chimney and Sontag. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
